Vzgoja je lahko tudi šaljiva
Gre samo zelo resno ali je lahko tudi zabavno? Najboljša kombinacija je vsakega malo.
03 Nov 2019, 13:05 by Mira Bizjan*



Naučiti jih je mogoče marsikaj, tudi prav posebne hoje. Fotografiji: osebni arhiv



Po zadnjih tacah – z malo vaje in spodbude bo znal tudi to.


Določene pojme si ljudje razlagamo vsak po svoje. Če rečemo dosledno, eni mislijo, da morajo biti strogi. Če želimo, da nas pes jemlje resno, to ne pomeni zastarelega prepričanja pokaži mu, kdo je gospodar, saj zdaj že precej let vemo, da je bila teorija o dominanci popolnoma zgrešena, in tisti, ki sledimo novim dognanjem o pasjem dojemanju sveta okrog sebe, njene uporabe pri šolanju nikakor ne priporočamo. Ker smo tudi sicer v življenju lastniki psov zelo različni, imamo tudi želje, koliko ubogljivosti pričakujemo od psa, vsak drugačne.Pes ni robotDa bi lahko kuža v trenutku opustil igro in začel slediti našim navodilom, ga je treba teh prehodov naučiti. Pri tem nam bo v veliko pomoč, če bo pes poznal besede: konec, stop, nehaj, ne zdaj … Pri paru človek-pes je namreč pomembno, da drug drugega upoštevata. Moje mnenje je, da psu ni treba postati robot – kdaj pač ni razpoložen za sodelovanje in to sme tudi pokazati. Če je človek dovolj iznajdljiv, ga bo vseeno znal pripraviti k sodelovanju. Za oba bo bolj prijetno, če bo uporabil šaljiv pristop.
Ne samo voda in hrana
Vsakemu psu pripadajo (in če mu tega ne moreš ponuditi, ni prav, da si ga nabaviš): hrana in voda, mir, da počiva, kolikor hoče, sprehod, ki ima štiri namene: vohljanje okolice, hoja brez vlečenja na povodcu, sprostitev ob pasjih prijateljih ali igra z vodnikom in nekaj minut šolanja, vsakodnevno učenje doma, ki poteka od 10 do 30 minut in en do dva dneva na teden v tečaju, ko mora kuža odmisliti sošolce in ubogati. In seveda mojčkanje, čohljanje in pregledovanje celega psa ter nega: česanje, kopanje, čiščenje zob, oči, ušes … Če mu vse to pravilno odmerimo (ob upoštevanju svojega urnika), lahko upravičeno pričakujemo, da bo z nami rad sodeloval. Ne bo treba ukiniti normalnih obrokov in psa hraniti samo iz roke zato, da bi spoznal, kako zelo je odvisen od nas.
Sodelovanje


Po zadnjih tacah – z malo vaje in spodbude bo znal tudi to.

Določeno vedenje od vzgojenega psa sicer pričakujemo: da ne vleče med hojo, da ne podivja, če ga za par minut nekam pripnemo, da se zna umiriti, če koga srečamo, in obleži ob nas tudi, če s prijatelji dve uri klepetamo ob pitju kave. Z eno besedo bi to poimenovali: sodelovanje. Pes zelo dobro ve, kdaj smo resni in kdaj se hecamo. Naša naloga pa je, da ga naučimo preklopiti sredi igre nazaj v mirno poslušnost. To bo težko izvedljivo, če ga bomo najprej lovili po vrtu, se skrivali za vogalom in planili za njim, ko bo pritekel mimo, kar ga sicer neskončno zabava, ampak če ga nismo že prej naučili, da je vsake igre enkrat konec, se bo poskušal hecati naprej tudi, ko bi ga mi želeli umiriti.
Učenje trikcev
Kaj sploh pomeni zabavno šolanje? Vedno znova ugotavljamo, da je učenje trikcev poleg tega, da je zabavno, tudi zelo koristno za utrjevanje poslušnosti in sodelovanja. Na kakšni tekmi agilityja ali na izpitih pogosto vidimo vodnike, ki tik pred startom naredijo s svojim psom par njemu najljubših trikov, kar ga spravi v pravo razpoloženje za dober nastop. Moja tibetanka od vseh trikov najbolj obožuje najino skupno hojo, ko položi tačke na moje superge. To mi je »povedala« ob neki priložnosti, ko sem rekla: »Zdaj pa mislim, da sva pokazali vse, kar znaš.« Ob tej moji izjavi je stekla okrog mene, se z gobčkom prerinila skozi moje noge in odločno stopila nanje ter se mi zazrla v oči (beri: pričakujem nagrado). Ni me presenetila samo s tem, da je predlagala eno od naučenih vedenj, na katero se tisti hip nisem spomnila, ampak predvsem to, da je bilo videti, kot da je razumela, kaj sem rekla, in je hotela pokazati, da zna še nekaj.Pes nas ne bo nič manj upošteval, če ga bomo učili na bolj zabaven način, nobene potrebe ni po zaostrovanju, če bomo vse od začetka dosledni in vztrajni.1Prepričanje pokaži mu, kdo je gospodar, je zastarelo, saj že precej let vemo, da je bila teorija o dominanci popolnoma zgrešena.2Učenje trikcev je zabavno in poleg tega zelo koristno za utrjevanje poslušnosti in sodelovanja.3Psu ni treba postati robot – včasih pač ni razpoložen za sodelovanje in sme to tudi pokazati.*Mira Bizjan je inštruktorica v šoli ŠVRK, Ljubljana, telefon: 041-734-995, FB: Šola Švrk

Education can also be humorous
Is it just very serious or can it be fun? The best combination is every now and then.
03 Nov 2019, 12:05 by Mira Bizjan *



There are many things to learn, including special walks. Photos: personal archive



After the last paws - with a little exercise and encouragement, he will know this too.


We interpret certain concepts in our own way. To put it consistently, some think they have to be strict. If we want the dog to take us seriously, this does not mean the outdated belief of showing him who is the master, since for many years now we have known that the theory of dominance has been completely missed, and those who follow new developments about the dog's perception of the world around him , we do not recommend its use in schooling. Because dogs are very different in their lives, we also have a desire for how much obedience we expect from a dog, each different. A dog is not a robot If a puppy can abandon the game and start following our instructions, he needs to learn these passages. It will be of great help to us if the dog knows the words: end, stop, stop, not now ... It is important for a human-dog couple to take into account one another. My opinion is that a dog does not have to become a robot - when it is not in the mood to participate, and it can show. If a person is resourceful enough, they will still be able to prepare him or her to cooperate. It will be more enjoyable for both of them if he uses a humorous approach.
Not just water and food
They belong to every dog (and if you can't offer it, it's not right to get one): food and water, peace to rest as much as you want, a walk that has four purposes: sniffing around, walking without pulling on a leash, relaxing with dog friends or playing with a guide and a few minutes of schooling, daily home-schooling that takes 10 to 30 minutes and one to two days a week in a class when the puppy has to think about classmates and obey. And of course blinking, sneezing and scanning the whole dog and grooming: combing, bathing, brushing teeth, eyes, ears… If we get it right (considering his schedule), we can reasonably expect him to work with us. It will not be necessary to discontinue normal meals and keep the dog out of his hands only to realize how much he depends on us.
Collaboration


After the last paws - with a little exercise and encouragement, he will know this too.

We expect a certain behavior from a raised dog: that he does not pull while walking, that he does not go wild, if he is pinned somewhere for a few minutes, that he can calm down, if we meet someone, and lie with us, even if we chat with friends for two hours while drinking coffee . In a word, you would call it: collaboration. The dog knows very well when we are serious and when we are kidding. But our job is to teach him to switch back to quiet obedience in the middle of the game. It will be difficult to do it if we first hunt him in the garden, hide around the corner and plan for him as he runs past, which is endless fun, but if we haven't taught him before that every game is over, tried to run forward even when I wanted to calm him down.
Learning the tricks
What does entertaining school really mean? Time and again we find that learning tricks, in addition to being fun, is also very useful for reinforcing obedience and collaboration. At some agility race or exams, we often see guides who, right before the start, do a few of his favorite tricks with his dog, which puts him in the right mood for a good show. My Tibetan most adores our shared walking when she puts her feet on my sneakers. She "told" this to me on one occasion when I said, "Now I think we have shown everything you know." At that statement, she ran around me, slid through my legs with a sponge, and stepped firmly on them and stepped on them. looked me in the eye (read: I expect a reward). Not only did she surprise me by suggesting one of the learned behaviors that I did not remember at that moment, but most of all, that she seemed to understand what I was saying and wanted to show that she knew something else .The dog will take no less account of it if we teach it in a more fun way, there is no need to sharpen it if we are consistent and persistent from the beginning.
